poem:
The Underpass Echo of the Glarblewump

1  
Beware the underpass, my lad, where glarblewumps do skrall,  
The drip-drap drops in dankish dark, the shadows slink and sprawl;  
With flibber-flubber footfall-fear, the echoes growl and call—  
“O never stray at neb-nine night beneath the echo-wall!”  

2  
He took the vorpal boomstaff bright, the clatterclack of clave,  
He slung the shimmer-shield of shard, the glimmergong he gave;  
He whistled widdle-warble tunes to hearten half the brave,  
Then tip-toe-tapped through tunnel black, the glarblewump to grave.  

3  
Snicker-snack! The boomstaff smacked, the echo answered back—  
“KRACK-THROOM-KRACK!” the caverns clapped, the darkness dripped in black;  
The glarblewump with gurgle-gape and goggle-eyes of wrack  
Came flumping, thumping, thunder-lump, to meet the echo-smack!  

4  
One! Two! The boomstaff through! The shimmer-shield went ring!  
The glarblewump gave gargle-gasp, its wobble-wings went wing;  
It tumbled, crumbled, rumbled down, a writhing, wreathing thing—  
The echo roared in triumph-roar, “Huzza-huzza-ZING!”  

5  
He hauled the hulking husk of gloom, the trophy-tum of pride,  
He danced a dazzle-dapple jig where drip-drap drops had dried;  
The tunnel twirled with twink-twonk cheers, the shadows shrank and sighed,  
And home he strode with echo-song still ringing at his side.  

6  
Beware the underpass, my lad, where glarblewumps once skrall,  
The drip-drap drops in dankish dark, the shadows slink and sprawl;  
Yet now the echoes chant his name, a gleeful gallant call—  
“O sing the bold who braved the night beneath the echo-wall!”

poem:
The Fogwyrm’s Dawndrallop

Beware the brumewhirl, my child, the mist that mims and mokes,  
It slithers through the sillgroves where the dawnlight barely brokes.  
The fogwyrm snorflers, snuffling, with a snicker-snack of nose,  
Its breath a brrr-brrr billow that no lantern ever glows.  

He took the vorpal sunblade in his hand so bright and brash,  
He donned the glimmergallop cloak that shimmered with a flash.  
With whiffle-whaffle warcry he went waffling through the haze,  
To meet the murkbeast Murkle where the morning murkly lays.  

One, two! One, two! The clashclack rang, the fog went fizz and fray,  
The snicker-snack of steel on scale, the splish of silver spray.  
He left it dead, its snorfling ceased, its misty heart unseamed,  
And came galumphing, glory-glad, the hero newly gleamed.  

O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay! The sunbeams burst in song,  
They danced on dewdrop dingles where the fog no more belongs.  
Come beamble, bramble, brightbelles, ring the skybells, blow the horns—  
The fogwyrm’s dawndrallop is done, the daylight newly born!  

Beware the brumewhirl, my child, the mist that mims and mokes,  
It slithers through the sillgroves where the dawnlight barely brokes.

poem:
The Want-Wending Waywock

Beware the skrelch-path’s shimbril snare,  
The slantling grass where glimmersnark gleams,  
For footfalls feel the ferrow-bare,  
Where no stone road nor sun-dream streams.  

Take up the glinting glaive of glass,  
The moon-milled blade the bards once sang,  
With tattertune and tintinngrass,  
Go girdle-glad where glimmersnark sprang.  

Through whisp-wound dusk he slithered—snap!  
The Waywock, whiskered, wobble-willed;  
He crooned a crackle-clap, clap-clap,  
Till rootling hearts with rapture thrilled.  

One flash—ffftung!—the glass-blade whirled,  
It sliced the shimmer, split the shade;  
The Waywock’s whiskered wonder-world  
Fell fizzling in the ferny glade.  

Back home they ring the razzle-bells,  
They dance the dapple-drum delight;  
The path grows straight where story swells—  
Yet still the warning whispers night.  

Beware the skrelch-path’s shimbril snare,  
The slantling grass where glimmersnark gleams;  
For footfalls feel the ferrow-bare,

The Chalkfoil Chronicle

The Marblat Map

poem:
The Tumbling of the Gloxalune

Beware the shiver-scrattle, yow!
It skrims through flanneldusk and vrooms;
The Gloxalune with snoggle-brow
Will cranx the night with gloom-galooms.

He fibber-flaps with slishy tongue,
Glisper-clamps the hush-tones tight;
His glitch upon the croon is flung—
Beware the blur-flood’s blinding blight!

I gripped the zimmerpike of phlox,
I belted on the glorkle-blade,
And with a star-snared thermo-box
I swam the drubble-deep cascade.

By smackle-reefs of whisper-glass
Where zank-shells chime in chuckled shoals,
When sizzle-spore wakes whickering bass
The Gloxalune unreeled his coils.

Krkk-Krakkk!—my zimmerpike it flew!
Swish-clang!—my glorkle-blade replied!
We flanged and thranged in prismic blue
Till fizz-breaths whimpered, seethed—and died.

With boomaroo and blattled song
We flappered back through prism-pray;
The twindle-bells went “pling-a-long!”
As gaffled-scrag drummed drum-dum day.

Beware the shiver-scrattle, cheer!
It skrims no more; our realm regrooms;
The Gloxalune’s a moon-song mere—
We banished all the gloom-galooms.

poem:
**The Umbrellafrumbus**

Beware the Splishersquall, my son, the dripple-drum that shivers!  
The snarling soggies slurp and slink, where puddles giggle-plash.  
He stalks the storm with splatterclaws, through gutters gulching rivers,  
So clutch your clankled canopy, your crimson clap-clash sash!

O sharpen up your spanglestick, your ribbed and ready thunder,  
O polish every paraglide and lacquer every lace.  
The grommet-guards are glistening, the gamp’s a gleaming wonder,  
The ferrule flicks and fancies free, a flash of fending face.

He slithers in the drizzle-dark, all drippery and drooping,  
With goggle-eyes of thunderlight and talons tipped with hail.  
The umbrellafrumbus lunges—snarfling, snorting, swooping—  
But twirls the twirler’s tungsten tip, a whirlwind-whirling sail!

Zzzip—zing—clang!—the canopy claps! The rainbows ricochet!  
Krrrack—krrrumble—ksssh!—the rivets ring! The rumbles roll away!  
The creature coughs a cloudburst choke, collapses into spray—  
Then hush! The hushdrops hush again, the stormstruck skies obey.

O homeward through the hush of hue, beneath the butter-sunbeam,  
We swagger with our victor-veil, a trophy trimmed in teal.  
We dance the drizzle-daisy steps, and pipe the puddle-daydream,  
As bells of brindled bubble-brass go bonging through the weal.

O ever heed the warning-word: the Splishersquall still shivers!  
Yet carry now your crimson clap, your clankled cloud-defence.  
For though the sky may spit and spit, through gutters gulching rivers,  
The umbrellafrumbus fears the flash of fending confidence!

poem:
The Slimefair Fangaroo

Beware the Slimefair Fangaroo, my lad, the squishy squall!  
The squeeble-goo, the gloppalump, the fizzerstorm that spits!  
Beware the pop-splat kaboom, the blorptube’s wobbling sprawl,  
And shun the frumious sporkle-snarl that drools in quantum bits!  

He took his beaker-blade in hand, long time the moldy maze he sought—  
So rested he by the test-tube tree, and stood awhile in thunk.  
Then whiffling through the data-dank, his hypotheses he brought,  
And burbled plans with ping-ping pens that clickered as they clunk.  

And as in petri thought he stood, the Fangaroo with eyes of glow,  
Came blobbering through the expo-haze, burbling gobbledegloop!  
One, two! Click-clack, drip-drop! The beaker-blade went swoosh-snow,  
He left it dead, with fizzy head—he went galumphing back in loop.  

“And hast thou slain the Fangaroo? Come to my arms, my beamish boy!  
O frabjous day! Callooh! Callay!” The mentors chortled cheers.  
They hoisted high the trophy-tube, they danced with fizzy joy,  
And the whiffle-waves of whoop-whoop rang across the lab-lit spheres.  

Beware the Slimefair Fangaroo, my lad, the squishy squall!  
The squeeble-goo, the gloppalump, the fizzerstorm that spits!  
Hold fast your beaker-blade of thought, should blorptube shadows sprawl—  
For every fair spawns Fangaroos in fresh, frumious fits!

poem:
Ballad of the Chromowock  

Beware the Filmic Fangèd Beak, the reelwound Razzlevix!  
Its clikklatt claws, its spirish spool, the snarlight of its tricks;  
Beware the flash-sting, shutter-snap, the silver-snake it spits—  
Tread soft, O lensling, soft and slow, through darkroom drifts.  

Child Lensling, clad in candled cloak of kelvin-swatch and gauze,  
With tripodeld griptap in hand and flitter-pouch in claw,  
She whisper-whets her graphet-glass and winds the wondrus spar—  
“Today I trap the Razzlevix in chroma-bars!”  

Through F-stopped forests, grainy green, the whirr of silver wings;  
She stalks its shadow—snapp, snatt!—where nitrate nightmare sings.  
A glimmawhim, a blinkblack bulge—the beast! Its iris rings!  
She frames the fangflash, snaps the catch—SLATTLATCH—victory rings.  

Back gleaming along lantern lanes, the reels in ribbons roll;  
She bathes them quick in chemic-lick—fixity’s gentle soul.  
Home sings with tintinnabulight—fireflies in a bowl—  
And elders cry, “Brave Lensling, our film-frights you made whole!”  

Beware the Filmic Fangèd Beak, no more the Razzlevix!  
Its clikkclatt claws, its spirish spool, lie hushed in paper brick;  
Yet soft! Another roll uncoils—a newborn night-bright fix—  
Tread soft, new lensling, soft and slow, through darkroom drifts.

poem:
The Umbragglewhirl Fandangle

Beware the rainwraith, brumal vift!—
The flibbering swirl of spry!
Its whimperwhisp will drip and drift
a hushly pour from sky.

Thriccled clocks yell “Squallosoon!—
stow cytopaddles quick!”
So tatterflask the tingling toon,
let gyreling puddles slick.

He took the thrumbrella-axel, bright,—
a whirlgilt twinged with lore;
he twirled the grip with twickering light,
and kicked the hatchway door.

Through glumblegroves a-shrumbling deep
the young Umbristian stept;
The Nimbulox, with phlumbareep,
from thundertherm was swept.

With wiffled warble, wuthering wings,—
it swooped through pewter spray!
"Snickersnap!" he snapped with swings
of frame forged not to fray.

Clish-clash! the spokes in spiral spin,
Krrr-ik-ik-ik! the rain;
The beast let out a gurthlegrin
then dropt like drain-torn drain.

Return he rode on rainbow-scroll,—
his hoots of hap resound;
The townsfolk spilled with squashy roll
to thump the squelchy ground.

In flambish flame each giggle-teemed
around the victor brave;
They sang of peekahours redeemed
from brooding cloud-crumpled grave.

And now behold: same hush returns—
soft slope of silver sigh;
Beware the rainwraith, brumal churns!—
still flibber-swirls the sky.

Cartographagonniad  

Beware the foggle, wandering wide, the cartolisked Karnagyle!  
Its gyresny claws on parchment gnaw, where foldledacies sigh and swirl;  
Creaselights quaver, crevasse-quiver, hills of heather briefly writ & whirl:  
Tap-tum-tap, fizz-fang! the furious flap of groovegrim map mouths gnish and gnarl.  

From attic gloom the pilgrim pranced with rollickscroll and inknit pride;  
A wiggle-wand, a tangleterp, three rainbowrocks of route he tied.  
He sprinkled gloop, the graphs grew deep, the hushlets hushed, the dreamlanes wide—  
With frostfeathered fist he sealed each twist: “This scroll shall never slide!”  

Oh snap! the Carnagyle emerged from saplaced strata, snarlodos groan;  
Cracklequake! murmurland thundered as paperpeaks sprang unbeknown.  
It swirgled, twirged; inkivory flames of mapmasque swam, glarr-gleam-glow!  
He swish-biffed south, then jargled north—whoomroar, zingdraw—strike bowne!  

With clockwhirl leap and compass-cry he poked its pictograph eye-o;  
The creature hissed a squidgy sigh, collapsed into indigo.  
He stitched the slain in satin seam—warm wordhymn, silk sky-o;  
He bore the once-blurred world ashore and offered cheer and wine-o!  

Home trooped the chartling, hush and hythe; the guildglucks glassed a gleesome glee;

The Shutterwocky

Beware the filmflam, flickerfox, the whirr-wheeze wheeze-whirr!  
The grainy gloam that gobbles light, the silver-splintered blur!  
He prowls the darkroom dusk, he snarls in celluloid snarls,  
He snaps the souls of snapshots, he steals the starlight’s swirl.  

He flexes his sprocket-sinew, he clacks his claw of chrome,  
He breathes a fog of fixer, he makes the emulsion moan.  
His iris is a vortex, his gaze a gamma glare—  
He gulps the glimmers, gorges, then vanishes in air.  

So shutter your shutters, shutterbugs, and load the lucent lead;  
Wind tight the winder, warriors, and prime the powder-red.  
With tripod-talons trembling, with meter-murmured might,  
We march through midnight meadows to meet the monster’s bite.  

We carry clickclack courage, we clutch the candled lens,

The moon is our magnesium, the stars our silver flare—  
We stalk the shutter-shadows, we sniff the static air.  

Lo! Sudden—shhhrrr-click!—the Shutterwock! His f-stop fangs aflare!  
He flares in fluro-flashes, he flings his flayer-flare!  
But swift I swing the shutter-sword, the flashbulb flares aflare—  
Zzz-zip! Zzz-zap! The creature crumples, felled by fluro-flare!

The Snarflute Slithersong

"Beware the Rumblitrum, my scrip,  
the drums that brump, the cymbals zazz;  
those zigglywumpers love to whip  
their snoggle-throngs in jarring jazz.  

Take heed the hootpipe’s hollow hah,  
and grumble-strings that grrrumph and groan!  
In tremor-time they twist the ta-tah,  
toss tumbletales of overblown."  

He clashed the clappers, click-clack-clack,  
he tuned his torkled tinkerlance;  
he strapped a strumpet on his back—  
its flamflam valves a-skitterdance.  

Then moseymode to metronome,  
through snarklescalè of sliding slate;  
he stepped into the rosemere dome  
where echoed every elltuned fate.  

Zizzz! Whrummph! The Rumblitrum arose,  
its bristle-bass a booming broom;  
it swirled a whirlwind vortex dose—  
a strobey storm across the room.  

He thrust through thunder, thrummed his chord,  
a splintersprite of silvery shout;  
the creature crooned, then cracked, then soared—  
burst bubble-bright and sizzled out.  

"So slash and serend the gloom’s despair;  
come triumpet back with tinny tongue!"  
He drummed the rafters, flung the air,  
and every tacet tintinnab' rung.  

Now chorusbells in caramel sing,  
the floorboards frolic fretful-free;  
they caper-croon the slain-snark zing—  
a jubilee of jublee.  

"Beware the Rumblitrum, my scrip...  
yet dare its drums—let brazen jazz!  
For zigglywumpers, cracked and clipped,  
now hum in hush within the hazz."

The Déjàvoozle’s Dirge

He donned the cloak of clockspun thread and clattered clack his shoes;

poem:
The Creepwok's Croon

Beware the gloamgrim, the grithling creep,

The grandfolk warn with wobble-wail:

it snags the sleepless air.”  

He took the vorpal vibroblade,

and stepped the starlit trail.  
He sought the skreek-skraw skarn of stone  
where moonmuck mushrooms moan;  
he whistled whee-whee, whistled lone,  
his heart a thunderdrone.  

One, two!  One, two!  The vibroblade  
went zip-zang, zip-zang, zip!  
He left it dead, the gloamgrim fade,  
he clutched its glisking lip.

poem:
The Want-Whispered Wantwyrm Trail

Beware the fizzled fernways, where footfalls flump and flare,  
For slinketh the Wantwyrm Wyst, with whisk-whorls in the air;  
Through slitherslade and moonmoss, the mucklers mark its glare—  
The shimmer-shamble shimmer of the trail none ought to dare.  

With clatterclack of courage, young Bramblebrunt set out,  
He packed a glisterglave and a pocketful of doubt;  
His heart went thrum-thump-thunder to the drum-drip of the route,  
While night-nibs nipped his kneeknobs like nibber-nasty grout.  

He met the gilder-gulping Wantwyrm Wyst at Widdershins Bend,  
Its eyes were emerald ember, its talons twist-trend;  
He swung his glisterglave in a glitter-gusty blend—  
Snicker-snack! Shiver-shock! The Wantwyrm’s want did end.  

He lugged the limp-lulled lizard through the lamplight of the vale,  
Where townsfolk twirled their torches and toasted triple-ale;  
They sang of Bramblebrunt the brave, whose blade would never pale—  
Yet still they speak in whispers: the trail still breathes its tale.  

Beware the fizzled fernways, where footfalls flump and flare,  
For though the Wantwyrm’s vanished, the wanting’s waiting there;  
Through slitherslade and moonmoss, the mucklers mark its glare—

poem:
The Humwhirl Howl  

'Beware the Thrumrail, spry-kitty kin!'  
warned wheezetalk Grandersnipe, quiver-quilled.  
'Its sizzle-surge skips spark-skin, boils thin;  
near-snare, near-snarl, by volt it’s thrilled.'

shivsilver blades in zing-zank belts they clave.  
With jump-jarring hearts thehyrums scheming—

(Spark-spears spire-sprung!) Then a shuddering thaw—  
the Zyther’s quartz-throat swallowed the train.  

They cart-carried coils, caught chrome compressions,  
back-bounced beneath candent city sky.  
Gillygongs gonged—great jolt-processions—  
'No whistle wakes the Thrumrail! Now fly!'

poem:
The Flickerframed Frollic

Beware the filmic fralicam, the shutter-bent snapglare gloam!  
Take heed where silver sprockets sing shrill sprockalicious “whirr-click-whirr!”  
Its spooled stripes slither, slurping light, through lens-glass’ whispered gloam.  
Yet still the villagers vivify—its click-clix capture they fear most, for fear-flick fur.

He tucked his tripod trembling-tight—Timothy Tot the braver—  
His pockets packed with photon-film, his heart a thump-thump drum.  
A satchel of flash-bangs swung, chiming clang-clang-clang with flavor,  
He sallied forth at silver-dawn; to face the beast he’d come.

Through fog-glint fields he flung himself, the flarion paths aflick;  
A glim-glum grunt of Frollicam came gurgling from the reeds—  
“Whirr-click! Snap-snap! Snikty-snik!” it snarled, each syllable a tick.  
Timothy twirled his tripod spear—grit-grit—he planted fierce, fierce deeds.

The beast lunged—lens a-goggle, reels awhirl like wind-warped wings!  
Timothy leapt—flash-flare—“BANG-SNAP!”—one silvershot strobe-burst split night!  
The Frollicam flopped, film-framed and felled, its final focus softly flings  
A final click. Silence shimmered. The village glowed with lantern-bright light.

Home he trotted, trophy strip in hand—click-clix clack in his coat,  
The crowd sang clickity-clacks of joy, popping cork-pops of gleeful glee.  
They toasted Tim, the tamer true; they danced in dim-room light afloat,  
And carved a chronicle: “Here fell Frollicam—film-free forever let it be!”

Beware the filmic fralicam, the shimmer-snapped gloaming glare!  
Its ghost still whirs in celluloid dreams with “whirr-click-whirr” and snap-snap fur.
